channel.title: Best builds for PvP
channel.description:
I quit Runescape back in '07 when the wilderness was removed, but I'm now interested in making another account (A pker) for these new updates. I'm curious about what you guys think are the best pvp builds. Back in the day when I pked, it was all about pures, but I have absolutely no idea if it's still like that. Basically, what is most effective these days?
Note: p2p not f2p

item.title: Best builds for PvP

item.description:
@Squirt_Ltd wrote:

A maxed pure brid all the way

item.title: Best builds for PvP
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“lpxd, post:9, topic:379267”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=475114.msg3474558#msg3474558 date=1295573401]
Best f2p:
40 att, max your str (80+) and 40 def
Lure in balanced players who have like 65 of everything, then destroy!!!
[/quote]
Except a set of rune and 65 defence pretty much stops anything 40 attack can throw at it.[/quote]

No my friend used the setup, made alot cash, not much trouble hitting either.

Read full topic

item.title: Best builds for PvP
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Im going with 3 accounts for the wildy that will allow me to be the best pker I can be:

  1. A main pker with 90+ att str def mage range and 95 prayer for turmoil etc. Just have to max out and summoning doesnt hurt too.
    2)A turmoil pure with 94 mage 90+ range, 60attack 90strength 30 defence and 95 prayer
    3)The easiest to make and I almost have this account completed but a simple medium level pure with 60-75 attack, 90+stength and 20+ defence. Im trying to quest defence and attack as much as I can on this account but I really dont want to waste my time on it.

On both the turmoil and medium level pure im waiting for the new wildy to see if summoning affects your combat before I train it but I do loot charms.

Read full topic

item.title: Best builds for PvP
item.dc:creator: @lpxd lpxd
item.description:
@lpxd wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:8, topic:379267”]Best f2p:
40 att, max your str (80+) and 40 def
Lure in balanced players who have like 65 of everything, then destroy!!![/quote]
Except a set of rune and 65 defence pretty much stops anything 40 attack can throw at it.

For P2P pures, I can recommend turmoil zerker pures; they are a lot of work though.
For lower levels, corrupt pures (20 attack, high strength, using corrupt vls or hammer) are pretty good.
D claws are a must for 60 attack pures.
Main pking: 95 Prayer and Turmoil if you can. If not, at least get 94 mage.
My main atm is 90 attk/99 str/ 78 def/ 70 pray/ 94 mage at level 113 cb. Pretty good pking stats.
Hope I helped.

Read full topic

item.title: Best builds for PvP
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

Thanks for the replies

My last pker was 1 defence, 82 mage, 80 strength, 60 attack. I did the whole ghostly robes, ice blitz + dds thing. Is that not effective anymore? (multi-zone pking)

Read full topic

item.title: Best builds for PvP
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

It really depends on what type of pking you want to do (Edgeville fights, PvP hybriding?)

[quote=“k0 twin, post:4, topic:379267”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=475114.msg3474449#msg3474449 date=1295566744]
Turmoil zerker, pretty much. As long as you can use ancient curses and hybrid with melee + magic, you pretty much can own.

But I don’t PK, but I voted yes anyway.
[/quote]
I definitely don’t have the money for 95 magic.[/quote]

You mean 95 prayer?

@OP:

If you want to be an edgeville pker, I’d go with stats like these:

70-80 attack
90 strength
60 defence
70 prayer
94 mage

90 Strength, piety, barrows gloves and vengeance are an ownage set to pk with. I’m level 103+7 (With those items and vengeance); I pretty much own most people my level (Even some of the turmoils). I edgeville PK - my stats are:
82 attack
88 strength
74 defence
70 prayer
95 magic

If you want to be a Hybrider, then I’d just max out all my stats (I doubt you’d have time for it, but it’s worth it at the end).

Read full topic
